content.description:
(Equalizer Early Exit.)

For those of us who can't climb V8, I propose this variation of

Equalizer

. Do all the same moves as

Equalizer

until you have your left hand on the corner (not the prow but the one before that. Dyno, deadpoint, or static your way up to the bomber jug, and top out.
content.location:
Use the same start as

Equalizer

.

content.description:
Slabhappy shares the start with

Equalizer

and heads straight up a slab.
content.location: Head up the trail until it flattens out. The Equalizer Boulder is an egg-shaped boulder in a clearing on the right side of the trail with a flat landing all around.

content.description: If you are looking at the boulder from the trail, The Prow begins as a sit start on the left side and goes straight up via the tallest section of rock.
content.location: Head up the trail until it flattens out. The Equalizer Boulder is an egg-shaped boulder in a clearing on the right side of the trail with a flat landing all around.

content.description: The Equalizer begins with a sit start just to the right of the overhang. Move left with feet below the overhang and hands above it, hang on to an awful pair of slopers on the boulder's corner, make a massive move left, and finish up the tall prow.
content.location: Head up the trail until it flattens out. The Equalizer Boulder is an egg-shaped boulder in a clearing on the right side of the trail with a flat landing all around.

content.description:
Sit start on

The Prow

, and trend up and right through low right handed sidepulls and high left handed slopers. Finish in the up the middle of the face facing the trail.
content.location: Head up the trail until it flattens out. The Equalizer Boulder is an egg-shaped boulder in a clearing on the right side of the trail with a flat landing all around.
